Timelines

Timelines are built in the source code as ordered lists. This format is useful for listing items as you would in a bullet list (unordered list).

Style Notes:

  1. Make sure to change the heading level so that it fits appropriately into the information architecture of the page's content.
  2. Only use this format to present more than a single point of information. 
  3. Please do not alter the color of the light teal bullet points.
  4. As implied by its name, this feature can be especially useful when presenting actual even timelines. In those cases, please use the Timelines with Headings option below and replace the heading-level title fields with time periods.
  5. If using the Timeline format to replace a regular bullet list, please use the Timelines without Headings option below. Please also use this formatting consistently. In other words, if you use a Timeline list in place of a bullet list once, please continue to do so anytime a bullet list would be necessary.

Timelines with Headings

This timeline list format includes heading-level text at each point.

  1. Timeline Title 1

    Insert information about this point here.

  2. Timeline Title 2

    Insert information about this point here.

  3. Timeline Title 3

    Insert information about this point here.

Timelines without Headings

This timeline list format only includes paragraph text at each point.

  1. Insert information about this point here.

  2. Insert information about this point here.

  3. Insert information about this point here.

Timelines with Headings and Child Lists

This timeline list format includes child list items under each main point.

  1. Timeline Title 1

    Insert information about this point here.

    • Child List Item
    • Child List Item
    • Child List Item

  2. Timeline Title 1

    Insert information about this point here.

    • Child List Item
    • Child List Item
    • Child List Item

  3. Timeline Title 1

    Insert information about this point here.

    • Child List Item
    • Child List Item
    • Child List Item
